item.title: Report X-2024080375
item.description:
Report X-2024080375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-13T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal can packaged in a plastic bag. The bottom chime on the can was damaged causing the release. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024080719
item.description:
Report X-2024080719

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-13T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 1 metal can of paint inside of a plastic bag surrounded by bubble wrap for dunnage. The can also had a plastic ring on the top of the can. The metal can was damaged/dented on the chime. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024080683
item.description:
Report X-2024080683

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels or markings on original packaging, seen on spider - see attached 91). SACR repacked box between 1:19 and 6:41 (see attached 92). 2 of 4x1gal plastic bottles Penofin Pro-Tech Wood Stripper Step 1 lost 0.3 gal from failed safety seals. SDS included in repack.

item.title: Report X-2024080651
item.description:
Report X-2024080651

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat shipped under 019 SVC code, no OP-900. Diamond, UN number, Proper Shipping Name (PSN), & UNPOP marking present. Two of 3x1gal plastic bottles Nu-Calgon Nu-Brite 4291-08 lost 0.6 gal from dented bodies. Box capacity is 4x1gal. Bubble wrap placed by shipper to fill 1 gal empty space.

item.title: Report X-2024080470
item.description:
Report X-2024080470

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles

item.title: Report X-2024080533
item.description:
Report X-2024080533

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans in plastic bags, separated with fiberboard dividers and closure rings. The closure ring on one can came loose and the lid opened up spilling the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024080534
item.description:
Report X-2024080534

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was six metal cans with closure rings and foam pads for dunnage. The rings on two of the cans came off and the lids opened up causing the contents to spill out inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

Inside of the fiberboard box there were seven glass bottles packaged in black plastic bags. One of the bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans with positive closure tabs and fiberboard dividers. One of the metal cans was dented on the top chime causing the lid to open and release the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: ON July 18th, during the sort process a drum with a strong odor was found to be leaking. The drum was labeled as UN3082, Environmentally hazardous substance, n.o.s., 9, III, and approximately 1L of liquid leaked out. It is unknown how the damage was caused to the drum that cause d the leak. It was placed into a steel salvage drum and is awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024080024
item.description:
Report E-2024080024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-09T00:38:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: PIONEER
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FISHER AUTO PARTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 93767
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The incident report was filed due to spillage of Diesel Fuel from the saddle tank from the power unit. The CMV jackknifed causing the saddle tank to be crush and releasing diesel fuel on the roadway. The driver failed to maintain control of the CMV and struck a guard rail. The roadway was wet and under construction (repaving) and the surface was uneven. No other vehicles were involved and no injuries were reported. A local Hazmat clean-up company (ECOtech, 50 Easy Street, London, KY. 40741) responded to the scene. They tapped the fuel tank and transferred the contents to slow/stop the leak. The materials used were hydrocarbon exsorbent pads, absorbent booms, recovery drum, skid steer, and a dump truck for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080045
item.description:
Report E-2024080045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ML ENERGY TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Circle K notified ERTS of a fuel overfill at a Mapco in Nashville, TN (Circle K bought out Mapco). It was reported that approximately 100 gallons of premium unleaded gasoline released due to the cap coming loose on the veerder-root system (measures the depth of how much fuel in the tank) when they were filling it. He has his lead driver on the way with oil dri, spill pads, and absorbent snakes and the area has been coned off. The release impacted asphalt and has spilled into the roadway, shutting down the Firestone next door. No storm drains or waterways are impacted by the release that he is aware of. He is not aware of any road closures or emergency personnel on site at this time but believes management will be notifying the fire department.
